definition: plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: Yes. I'd like to start with a cold dish, a chef's salad.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想第一道菜点一个冷盘和一个现配的色拉。

sentences.english: A dish of boned, stuffed meat or fish that is poached and served cold coated with aspic.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想第一道菜点一个冷盘和一个现配的色拉。

sentences.english: Chinese meal begins with cool meals while Western meal with soup.
sentences.chinese: 中餐先上冷盘，而西餐则先上汤。

sentences.english: Or, have it cold and raw with a blob of fiery wasabi.
sentences.chinese: 或者以全生的冷盘上桌，配有一抹让人燃烧的芥末料。

sentences.english: One is cutting up vegetables, the other ismaking hors d’oeuvres.
sentences.chinese: 一个是切蔬菜，另一种是做冷盘。

sentences.english: Try it together with a cold cut platter, and wedges of Pecorino.
sentences.chinese: 可以尝试和冷盘风干肉与佩科里诺干酪一起享用。

sentences.english: I wanted some more cold meat but there was none left.
sentences.chinese: 我想再吃些冷盘肉，但是一点也不剩了。

sentences.english: Here are your cold dishes, sir.

definition: appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
a dish that goes well with alcoholic drinks
tea and cake/refreshments/tea and dimsun 點心|点心, traditional Hong Kong lunch
to smell, look and taste great
